title.narrative: Améliorer l''accès aux soins de santé de base et aux services de reproduction d''urgence dans les zones sanitaires réceptrices des populations de l''Angola retournées et expulsées du Kasaï, du Kasaï central et du Kwango en RDC

description.narrative: The objective of this joint WHO/UNICEF/UNFPA project is provide free emergency health services in seven health zones in Kasai, Kasai Central and Kwango for vulnerable Congolese individuals returning and/or expelled from Angola. UNICEF will procure and deliver essential medicines and supplies to health facilities, including kits to detect and treat malaria and measles, as well as supplies for neonatal care. UNICEF and partners will also support a catch-up vaccination campaign. Approximately 200,000 people will benefit from the joint project over a six-month period.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

humanitarian-scope.narrative: CONGO, DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE DISPLACEMENT 2019

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS CONGO, DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2019

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
